compounddef.title: Free Energy Evaluation
compounddef.innergroup: Deprecated Interface for Free Energy Evaluation

sectiondef.header: Basic Energy Evaluation Interface with Dot-Bracket Structure String

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows for energy evaluation of a given pair of structure and sequence (alignment). Model details, energy parameters, and possibly soft constraints are used as provided via the parameter 'fc'. The vrna_fold_compound_t does not need to contain any DP matrices, but requires all most basic init values as one would get from a call like this: fc=vrna_fold_compound(sequence,NULL,VRNA_OPTION_EVAL_ONLY);

simplesect.para: Accepts vrna_fold_compound_t of type VRNA_FC_TYPE_SINGLE and VRNA_FC_TYPE_COMPARATIVE
vrna_eval_structure_pt(), vrna_eval_structure_verbose(), vrna_eval_structure_pt_verbose(), vrna_fold_compound(), vrna_fold_compound_comparative(), vrna_eval_covar_structure()

parameterdescription.para: A vrna_fold_compound_t containing the energy parameters and model details
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is attached as method eval_structure() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.eval_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Calculate the pseudo energy derived by the covariance scores of a set of aligned sequences.

detaileddescription.para: Consensus structure prediction is driven by covariance scores of base pairs in rows of the provided alignment. This function allows one to retrieve the total amount of this covariance pseudo energy scores. The vrna_fold_compound_t does not need to contain any DP matrices, but requires all most basic init values as one would get from a call like this: fc=vrna_fold_compound_comparative(alignment,NULL,VRNA_OPTION_EVAL_ONLY);

simplesect.para: Accepts vrna_fold_compound_t of type VRNA_FC_TYPE_COMPARATIVE only!
vrna_fold_compound_comparative(), vrna_eval_structure()

parameterdescription.para: A vrna_fold_compound_t containing the energy parameters and model details
Secondary (consensus) structure in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: The covariance pseudo energy score of the input structure given the input sequence alignment in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is attached as method eval_covar_structure() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.eval_covar_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA and print contributions on a per-loop base.

detaileddescription.para: This function is a simplyfied version of vrna_eval_structure_v() that uses the default verbosity level.

simplesect.para: vrna_eval_structure_pt(), vrna_eval_structure_verbose(), vrna_eval_structure_pt_verbose(),

parameterdescription.para: A vrna_fold_compound_t containing the energy parameters and model details
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is attached as method eval_structure_verbose() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.eval_structure_verbose()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA and print contributions on a per-loop base.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows for detailed energy evaluation of a given sequence/structure pair. In contrast to vrna_eval_structure() this function prints detailed energy contributions based on individual loops to a file handle. If NULL is passed as file handle, this function defaults to print to stdout. Any positive verbosity_level activates potential warning message of the energy evaluting functions, while values $ \ge 1 $ allow for detailed control of what data is printed. A negative parameter verbosity_level turns off printing all together.

Model details, energy parameters, and possibly soft constraints are used as provided via the parameter 'fc'. The fold_compound does not need to contain any DP matrices, but all the most basic init values as one would get from a call like this: fc=vrna_fold_compound(sequence,NULL,VRNA_OPTION_EVAL_ONLY);

simplesect.para: vrna_eval_structure_pt(), vrna_eval_structure_verbose(), vrna_eval_structure_pt_verbose(),

parameterdescription.para: A vrna_fold_compound_t containing the energy parameters and model details
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
The level of verbosity of this function
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in kcal/mol

memberdef.argsstring: (vrna_fold_compound_t *fc, const char *structure, int verbosity_level, vrna_cstr_t output_stream)
memberdef.name: vrna_eval_structure_cstr

sectiondef.header: Basic Energy Evaluation Interface with Structure Pair Table

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows for energy evaluation of a given sequence/structure pair where the structure is provided in pair_table format as obtained from vrna_ptable(). Model details, energy parameters, and possibly soft constraints are used as provided via the parameter 'fc'. The fold_compound does not need to contain any DP matrices, but all the most basic init values as one would get from a call like this: fc=vrna_fold_compound(sequence,NULL,VRNA_OPTION_EVAL_ONLY);

simplesect.para: vrna_ptable(), vrna_eval_structure(), vrna_eval_structure_pt_verbose()

parameterdescription.para: A vrna_fold_compound_t containing the energy parameters and model details
Secondary structure as pair_table

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in 10cal/mol

parblock.para: This function is attached as method eval_structure_pt() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.eval_structure_pt()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA.

detaileddescription.para: This function is a simplyfied version of vrna_eval_structure_simple_v() that uses the default verbosity level.

simplesect.para: vrna_eval_structure_pt_v(), vrna_ptable(), vrna_eval_structure_pt(), vrna_eval_structure_verbose()

parameterdescription.para: A vrna_fold_compound_t containing the energy parameters and model details
Secondary structure as pair_table
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in 10cal/mol

parblock.para: This function is attached as method eval_structure_pt_verbose() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.eval_structure_pt_verbose()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows for energy evaluation of a given sequence/structure pair where the structure is provided in pair_table format as obtained from vrna_ptable(). Model details, energy parameters, and possibly soft constraints are used as provided via the parameter 'fc'. The fold_compound does not need to contain any DP matrices, but all the most basic init values as one would get from a call like this: fc=vrna_fold_compound(sequence,NULL,VRNA_OPTION_EVAL_ONLY); In contrast to vrna_eval_structure_pt() this function prints detailed energy contributions based on individual loops to a file handle. If NULL is passed as file handle, this function defaults to print to stdout. Any positive verbosity_level activates potential warning message of the energy evaluting functions, while values $ \ge 1 $ allow for detailed control of what data is printed. A negative parameter verbosity_level turns off printing all together.

simplesect.para: vrna_ptable(), vrna_eval_structure_pt(), vrna_eval_structure_verbose()

parameterdescription.para: A vrna_fold_compound_t containing the energy parameters and model details
Secondary structure as pair_table
The level of verbosity of this function
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in 10cal/mol

sectiondef.header: Simplified Energy Evaluation with Sequence and Dot-Bracket Strings

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows for energy evaluation of a given sequence/structure pair. In contrast to vrna_eval_structure() this function assumes default model details and default energy parameters in order to evaluate the free energy of the secondary structure. Therefore, it serves as a simple interface function for energy evaluation for situations where no changes on the energy model are required.

simplesect.para: vrna_eval_structure(), vrna_eval_structure_pt(), vrna_eval_structure_verbose(), vrna_eval_structure_pt_verbose(),

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in kcal/mol

parblock.para: In the target scripting language, this function serves as a wrapper for vrna_eval_structure_simple_v() and, thus, allows for two additional, optional arguments, the verbosity level and a file handle which default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively.. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_structure_simple()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the free energy of a sequence/structure pair where the sequence is circular.

simplesect.para: vrna_eval_structure_simple(), vrna_eval_gquad_structure(), vrna_eval_circ_consensus_structure(), vrna_eval_circ_structure_v(), vrna_eval_structure()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: The free energy of the structure given the circular input sequence in kcal/mol

parblock.para: In the target scripting language, this function serves as a wrapper for vrna_eval_circ_structure_v() and, thus, allows for two additional, optional arguments, the verbosity level and a file handle which default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively.. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_circ_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the free energy of a sequence/structure pair where the structure may contain G-Quadruplexes.

detaileddescription.para: G-Quadruplexes are annotated as plus signs ('+') for each G involved in the motif. Linker sequences must be denoted by dots ('.') as they are considered unpaired. Below is an example of a 2-layer G-quadruplex: GGAAGGAAAGGAGG ++..++...++.++

simplesect.para: vrna_eval_structure_simple(), vrna_eval_circ_structure(), vrna_eval_gquad_consensus_structure(), vrna_eval_gquad_structure_v(), vrna_eval_structure()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: The free energy of the structure including contributions of G-quadruplexes in kcal/mol

parblock.para: In the target scripting language, this function serves as a wrapper for vrna_eval_gquad_structure_v() and, thus, allows for two additional, optional arguments, the verbosity level and a file handle which default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively.. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_gquad_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the free energy of a sequence/structure pair where the sequence is circular and the structure may contain G-Quadruplexes.

detaileddescription.para: G-Quadruplexes are annotated as plus signs ('+') for each G involved in the motif. Linker sequences must be denoted by dots ('.') as they are considered unpaired. Below is an example of a 2-layer G-quadruplex: GGAAGGAAAGGAGG ++..++...++.++

simplesect.para: vrna_eval_structure_simple(), vrna_eval_circ_gquad_consensus_structure(), vrna_eval_circ_gquad_structure_v(), vrna_eval_structure()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: The free energy of the structure including contributions of G-quadruplexes in kcal/mol

parblock.para: In the target scripting language, this function serves as a wrapper for vrna_eval_circ_gquad_structure_v() and, thus, allows for two additional, optional arguments, the verbosity level and a file handle which default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively.. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_circ_gquad_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA and print contributions per loop.

detaileddescription.para: This function is a simplyfied version of vrna_eval_structure_simple_v() that uses the default verbosity level.

simplesect.para: vrna_eval_structure_simple_v(), vrna_eval_structure_verbose(), vrna_eval_structure_pt(), vrna_eval_structure_verbose(), vrna_eval_structure_pt_verbose()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in kcal/mol

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *string, const char *structure, int verbosity_level, FILE *file)
memberdef.name: vrna_eval_structure_simple_v

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA and print contributions per loop.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows for detailed energy evaluation of a given sequence/structure pair. In contrast to vrna_eval_structure() this function prints detailed energy contributions based on individual loops to a file handle. If NULL is passed as file handle, this function defaults to print to stdout. Any positive verbosity_level activates potential warning message of the energy evaluting functions, while values $ \ge 1 $ allow for detailed control of what data is printed. A negative parameter verbosity_level turns off printing all together.

In contrast to vrna_eval_structure_verbose() this function assumes default model details and default energy parameters in order to evaluate the free energy of the secondary structure. Threefore, it serves as a simple interface function for energy evaluation for situations where no changes on the energy model are required.

simplesect.para: vrna_eval_structure_verbose(), vrna_eval_structure_pt(), vrna_eval_structure_pt_verbose(),

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
The level of verbosity of this function
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is available through an overloaded version of vrna_eval_structure_simple(). The last two arguments for this function are optional and default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_structure_simple()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *string, const char *structure, int verbosity_level, FILE *file)
memberdef.name: vrna_eval_circ_structure_v

briefdescription.para: Evaluate free energy of a sequence/structure pair, assume sequence to be circular and print contributions per loop.

detaileddescription.para: This function is the same as vrna_eval_structure_simple_v() but assumes the input sequence to be circularized.

simplesect.para: vrna_eval_structure_simple_v(), vrna_eval_circ_structure(), vrna_eval_structure_verbose()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
The level of verbosity of this function
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is available through an overloaded version of vrna_eval_circ_structure(). The last two arguments for this function are optional and default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_circ_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *string, const char *structure, int verbosity_level, FILE *file)
memberdef.name: vrna_eval_gquad_structure_v

briefdescription.para: Evaluate free energy of a sequence/structure pair, allow for G-Quadruplexes in the structure and print contributions per loop.

detaileddescription.para: This function is the same as vrna_eval_structure_simple_v() but allows for annotated G-Quadruplexes in the dot-bracket structure input.

G-Quadruplexes are annotated as plus signs ('+') for each G involved in the motif. Linker sequences must be denoted by dots ('.') as they are considered unpaired. Below is an example of a 2-layer G-quadruplex: GGAAGGAAAGGAGG ++..++...++.++

simplesect.para: vrna_eval_structure_simple_v(), vrna_eval_gquad_structure(), vrna_eval_structure_verbose()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
The level of verbosity of this function
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is available through an overloaded version of vrna_eval_gquad_structure(). The last two arguments for this function are optional and default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_gquad_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *string, const char *structure, int verbosity_level, FILE *file)
memberdef.name: vrna_eval_circ_gquad_structure_v

briefdescription.para: Evaluate free energy of a sequence/structure pair, assume sequence to be circular, allow for G-Quadruplexes in the structure, and print contributions per loop.

detaileddescription.para: This function is the same as vrna_eval_structure_simple_v() but assumes the input sequence to be circular and allows for annotated G-Quadruplexes in the dot-bracket structure input.

G-Quadruplexes are annotated as plus signs ('+') for each G involved in the motif. Linker sequences must be denoted by dots ('.') as they are considered unpaired. Below is an example of a 2-layer G-quadruplex: GGAAGGAAAGGAGG ++..++...++.++

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
The level of verbosity of this function
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is available through an overloaded version of vrna_eval_circ_gquad_structure(). The last two arguments for this function are optional and default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_circ_gquad_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

sectiondef.header: Simplified Energy Evaluation with Sequence Alignments and Consensus Structure Dot-Bracket String

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA sequence alignment.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows for energy evaluation for a given multiple sequence alignment and consensus structure pair. In contrast to vrna_eval_structure() this function assumes default model details and default energy parameters in order to evaluate the free energy of the secondary structure. Therefore, it serves as a simple interface function for energy evaluation for situations where no changes on the energy model are required.

simplesect.para: The free energy returned from this function already includes the covariation pseudo energies that is used fir comparative structure prediction within this library.
vrna_eval_covar_structure(), vrna_eval_structure(), vrna_eval_structure_pt(), vrna_eval_structure_verbose(), vrna_eval_structure_pt_verbose()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence alignment in uppercase letters and hyphen ('-') to denote gaps
Consensus Secondary structure in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: The free energy of the consensus structure given the input alignment in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is available through an overloadeded version of vrna_eval_structure_simple(). Simply pass a sequence alignment as list of strings (including gaps) as first, and the consensus structure as second argument. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_structure_simple()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the free energy of a multiple sequence alignment/consensus structure pair where the sequences are circular.

simplesect.para: The free energy returned from this function already includes the covariation pseudo energies that is used fir comparative structure prediction within this library.
vrna_eval_covar_structure(), vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple(), vrna_eval_gquad_consensus_structure(), vrna_eval_circ_structure(), vrna_eval_circ_consensus_structure_v(), vrna_eval_structure()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence alignment in uppercase letters
Consensus secondary structure in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: The free energy of the consensus structure given the circular input sequence in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is available through an overloadeded version of vrna_eval_circ_structure(). Simply pass a sequence alignment as list of strings (including gaps) as first, and the consensus structure as second argument. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_circ_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the free energy of a multiple sequence alignment/consensus structure pair where the structure may contain G-Quadruplexes.

detaileddescription.para: G-Quadruplexes are annotated as plus signs ('+') for each G involved in the motif. Linker sequences must be denoted by dots ('.') as they are considered unpaired. Below is an example of a 2-layer G-quadruplex: GGAAGGAAAGGAGG ++..++...++.++

simplesect.para: The free energy returned from this function already includes the covariation pseudo energies that is used fir comparative structure prediction within this library.
vrna_eval_covar_structure(), vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple(), vrna_eval_circ_consensus_structure(), vrna_eval_gquad_structure(), vrna_eval_gquad_consensus_structure_v(), vrna_eval_structure()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence alignment in uppercase letters
Consensus secondary structure in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: The free energy of the consensus structure including contributions of G-quadruplexes in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is available through an overloadeded version of vrna_eval_gquad_structure(). Simply pass a sequence alignment as list of strings (including gaps) as first, and the consensus structure as second argument. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_gquad_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the free energy of a multiple sequence alignment/consensus structure pair where the sequence is circular and the structure may contain G-Quadruplexes.

detaileddescription.para: G-Quadruplexes are annotated as plus signs ('+') for each G involved in the motif. Linker sequences must be denoted by dots ('.') as they are considered unpaired. Below is an example of a 2-layer G-quadruplex: GGAAGGAAAGGAGG ++..++...++.++

simplesect.para: The free energy returned from this function already includes the covariation pseudo energies that is used fir comparative structure prediction within this library.

vrna_eval_covar_structure(), vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple(), vrna_eval_circ_consensus_structure(), vrna_eval_gquad_structure(), vrna_eval_circ_gquad_consensus_structure_v(), vrna_eval_structure()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence alignment in uppercase letters
Consensus secondary structure in dot-bracket notation

simplesect.para: The free energy of the consensus structure including contributions of G-quadruplexes in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is available through an overloadeded version of vrna_eval_circ_gquad_structure(). Simply pass a sequence alignment as list of strings (including gaps) as first, and the consensus structure as second argument. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_circ_gquad_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the free energy of a consensus structure for an RNA sequence alignment and print contributions per loop.

detaileddescription.para: This function is a simplyfied version of vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple_v() that uses the default verbosity level.

simplesect.para: The free energy returned from this function already includes the covariation pseudo energies that is used fir comparative structure prediction within this library.
vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple_v(), vrna_eval_structure_verbose(), vrna_eval_structure_pt(), vrna_eval_structure_pt_verbose()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence alignment in uppercase letters. Gaps are denoted by hyphens ('-')
Consensus secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the conensus structure given the aligned input sequences in kcal/mol

memberdef.argsstring: (const char **alignment, const char *structure, int verbosity_level, FILE *file)
memberdef.name: vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple_v

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the free energy of a consensus structure for an RNA sequence alignment and print contributions per loop.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows for detailed energy evaluation of a given sequence alignment/consensus structure pair. In contrast to vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple() this function prints detailed energy contributions based on individual loops to a file handle. If NULL is passed as file handle, this function defaults to print to stdout. Any positive verbosity_level activates potential warning message of the energy evaluting functions, while values $ \ge 1 $ allow for detailed control of what data is printed. A negative parameter verbosity_level turns off printing all together.

simplesect.para: The free energy returned from this function already includes the covariation pseudo energies that is used fir comparative structure prediction within this library.
vrna_eval_consensus_structure(), vrna_eval_structure()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence alignment in uppercase letters. Gaps are denoted by hyphens ('-')
Consensus secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
The level of verbosity of this function
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the consensus structure given the sequence alignment in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is available through an overloaded version of vrna_eval_structure_simple(). Simply pass a sequence alignment as list of strings (including gaps) as first, and the consensus structure as second argument. The last two arguments are optional and default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_structure_simple()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

memberdef.argsstring: (const char **alignment, const char *structure, int verbosity_level, FILE *file)
memberdef.name: vrna_eval_circ_consensus_structure_v

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the free energy of a consensus structure for an alignment of circular RNA sequences and print contributions per loop.

detaileddescription.para: This function is identical with vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple_v() but assumed the aligned sequences to be circular.

simplesect.para: The free energy returned from this function already includes the covariation pseudo energies that is used fir comparative structure prediction within this library.
vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple_v(), vrna_eval_circ_consensus_structure(), vrna_eval_structure()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence alignment in uppercase letters. Gaps are denoted by hyphens ('-')
Consensus secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
The level of verbosity of this function
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the consensus structure given the sequence alignment in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is available through an overloaded version of vrna_eval_circ_structure(). Simply pass a sequence alignment as list of strings (including gaps) as first, and the consensus structure as second argument. The last two arguments are optional and default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_circ_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

memberdef.argsstring: (const char **alignment, const char *structure, int verbosity_level, FILE *file)
memberdef.name: vrna_eval_gquad_consensus_structure_v

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the free energy of a consensus structure for an RNA sequence alignment, allow for annotated G-Quadruplexes in the structure and print contributions per loop.

detaileddescription.para: This function is identical with vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple_v() but allows for annotated G-Quadruplexes in the consensus structure.

G-Quadruplexes are annotated as plus signs ('+') for each G involved in the motif. Linker sequences must be denoted by dots ('.') as they are considered unpaired. Below is an example of a 2-layer G-quadruplex: GGAAGGAAAGGAGG ++..++...++.++

simplesect.para: The free energy returned from this function already includes the covariation pseudo energies that is used fir comparative structure prediction within this library.
vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple_v(), vrna_eval_gquad_consensus_structure(), vrna_eval_structure()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence alignment in uppercase letters. Gaps are denoted by hyphens ('-')
Consensus secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
The level of verbosity of this function
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the consensus structure given the sequence alignment in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is available through an overloaded version of vrna_eval_gquad_structure(). Simply pass a sequence alignment as list of strings (including gaps) as first, and the consensus structure as second argument. The last two arguments are optional and default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_gquad_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

memberdef.argsstring: (const char **alignment, const char *structure, int verbosity_level, FILE *file)
memberdef.name: vrna_eval_circ_gquad_consensus_structure_v

briefdescription.para: Evaluate the free energy of a consensus structure for an alignment of circular RNA sequences, allow for annotated G-Quadruplexes in the structure and print contributions per loop.

detaileddescription.para: This function is identical with vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple_v() but assumes the sequences in the alignment to be circular and allows for annotated G-Quadruplexes in the consensus structure.

G-Quadruplexes are annotated as plus signs ('+') for each G involved in the motif. Linker sequences must be denoted by dots ('.') as they are considered unpaired. Below is an example of a 2-layer G-quadruplex: GGAAGGAAAGGAGG ++..++...++.++

simplesect.para: The free energy returned from this function already includes the covariation pseudo energies that is used fir comparative structure prediction within this library.
vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple_v(), vrna_eval_circ_gquad_consensus_structure(), vrna_eval_structure()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence alignment in uppercase letters. Gaps are denoted by hyphens ('-')
Consensus secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
The level of verbosity of this function
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the consensus structure given the sequence alignment in kcal/mol

parblock.para: This function is available through an overloaded version of vrna_eval_circ_gquad_structure(). Simply pass a sequence alignment as list of strings (including gaps) as first, and the consensus structure as second argument. The last two arguments are optional and default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_circ_gquad_structure()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

sectiondef.header: Simplified Energy Evaluation with Sequence String and Structure Pair Table

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA.

detaileddescription.para: In contrast to vrna_eval_structure_pt() this function assumes default model details and default energy parameters in order to evaluate the free energy of the secondary structure. Threefore, it serves as a simple interface function for energy evaluation for situations where no changes on the energy model are required.

simplesect.para: vrna_ptable(), vrna_eval_structure_simple(), vrna_eval_structure_pt()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure as pair_table

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in 10cal/mol

parblock.para: In the target scripting language, this function serves as a wrapper for vrna_eval_structure_pt_v() and, thus, allows for two additional, optional arguments, the verbosity level and a file handle which default to VRNA_VERBOSITY_QUIET and NULL, respectively. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline :py:func:`RNA.eval_structure_pt_simple()` in the :doc:`/api_python` .

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA.

detaileddescription.para: This function is a simplyfied version of vrna_eval_structure_pt_simple_v() that uses the default verbosity level.

simplesect.para: vrna_eval_structure_pt_simple_v(), vrna_ptable(), vrna_eval_structure_pt_verbose(), vrna_eval_structure_simple()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure as pair_table
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in 10cal/mol

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *string, const short *pt, int verbosity_level, FILE *file)
memberdef.name: vrna_eval_structure_pt_simple_v

briefdescription.para: Calculate the free energy of an already folded RNA.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows for energy evaluation of a given sequence/structure pair where the structure is provided in pair_table format as obtained from vrna_ptable(). Model details, energy parameters, and possibly soft constraints are used as provided via the parameter 'fc'. The fold_compound does not need to contain any DP matrices, but all the most basic init values as one would get from a call like this: fc=vrna_fold_compound(sequence,NULL,VRNA_OPTION_EVAL_ONLY); In contrast to vrna_eval_structure_pt_verbose() this function assumes default model details and default energy parameters in order to evaluate the free energy of the secondary structure. Threefore, it serves as a simple interface function for energy evaluation for situations where no changes on the energy model are required.

simplesect.para: vrna_ptable(), vrna_eval_structure_pt_v(), vrna_eval_structure_simple()

parameterdescription.para: RNA sequence in uppercase letters
Secondary structure as pair_table
The level of verbosity of this function
A file handle where this function should print to (may be NULL).

simplesect.para: The free energy of the input structure given the input sequence in 10cal/mol

sectiondef.header: Simplified Energy Evaluation with Sequence Alignment and Consensus Structure Pair Table

simplesect.para: The free energy returned from this function already includes the covariation pseudo energies that is used fir comparative structure prediction within this library.
vrna_eval_consensus_structure_simple(), vrna_eval_structure_pt(), vrna_eval_structure(), vrna_eval_covar_structure()

Secondary structure in pair table format

simplesect.para: Free energy of the consensus structure in 10cal/mol
